oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson Hotel Demolition, 1971
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the demolition of the Andrew Jackson Hotel in 1971. The hotel was demolished in order to make way for the James K. Polk Office Building, which currently contains the Tennessee Performing Arts Center. The Andrew Jackson Hotel opened its doors in August of 1925, and it was located on the east side of Memorial Plaza on the corner of 6th Avenue North and Deaderick Street. The 12-story structure boasted 400 guest rooms, and was designed by Marr & Holman architects. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.); Andrew Jackson Hotel (Nashville, Tenn.);
